So, looking at the underlying code in the code inspector, I see the italic from the rich text control just sets the html to a <em> tag which renders it a italic.  It is not setting a font size at all so the font-size is rendering what is set in your template.main.min.css in the body stylings (see screen 1 below).  I can manually set this to font-size: 8pt; to get what you really want (see screen 2 below).

Usually rich text area controls give you an <html> link in the top controls where you could modify the underlying html that is generated.  If you could, then you could add a class name to the <em> tag and then add styling for that class in your template.main.css file.  But you could also add a style just targeting the <em> element inside the main div container: <div class="campaign-cards ....  like so:   .campaign-cards em { font-size: 8pt; }  Please note that doing it this way would make ANY <em> tag that is inside the <div class="campaign-cards element to be that font size - so be careful to only add the italic where you want it.  It would be much better if you could add a class name to the <em> tag in the underlying html of the rich text control if you can find out how to get it to show you an <html> edit button.
